snippet: The bureau said it believed it had figured out who pulled off a famous theft of 13 works of art, valued at up to $500 million, from Boston’s Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.
abstract: Federal officials say they have figured out who pulled off brazen 1990 art theft of 13 works, valued at up to $500 million, from Boston's Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum; announce, 23 years to the day after robbery, that thieves belonged to criminal organization based in New England and Mid-Atlantic States.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and TOM MASHBERG
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Tom Mashberg contributed reporting from Boston.

lead_paragraph: The bureau said it believed it had figured out who pulled off a famous theft of 13 works of art, valued at up to $500 million, from Boston’s Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.

headline.seo: F.B.I. Says It Has Clues in ’90 Boston Art Heist
headline.main: A New Effort in Boston to Catch 1990 Art Thieves
headline.print_headline: A New Effort in Boston To Catch 1990 Art Thieves
